text:
<<Thank you for the kind offer. Unfortunately, your phone has zero to do with this. An examination of your phone records would yield as much
useful information as a review of our tax filings. As I have noted, you have devices that are registered to you with indoor audio/video drop-in
capabilities that work just the same if phones were never invented. If you would like a third party to explain that, please feel free. An expert can also
explain the tech behind the Blink cam incident. That is a simple, demonstrably reproducible scenario you can see live today, but you can refuse to see
that demonstrated yourself.>>
If I am as you allege, then I will pay for that review. If I am not, then you pay for it.
<<I have not alleged anything more than the fact that it is happening. I shared both when it happens and who the devices are registered to- You. I have
no way of knowing if it is you, the kids, or a visitor to the house. Only you are registered as the device owner on the initiating end (your iPhone, office
Alexa, others?) and that they call the receiving end (K-town Kitchen, Beach Office, Beach Deck, my Phone). In my heart, I don't believe you "spy" on
me any more than I spy on you. What good is that to either of us? It's just dumb and really provides no "strategic advantage" to anything we are trying
to accomplish as co-parents.>>
Quick Recap:
• On 10.21, after getting you a phone, I sent you an email (see attached) that said: "Christ... we are so intertwined. We will be sorting this out for
